instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V
threads.message:
Board had little corrosion on C2740 and C7825 other than that board is clean.

PPBUS 8.6V
PP5V_S5 5V
3V3_S5/SUS 3.3V
PLT_RESET_L 0V
ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V I get around 3V for a few seconds after I plug the charger.

threads.title: 820-00165 ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V
threads.message:
Which big coils get voltage?
Inspect U1950 for corrosion; remove it and resolder.
Also test desoldering Q8150.

threads.title: 820-00165 ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V
threads.message:
U1950 was clean but replaced it regardless, also removed Q8150 after replacing U1950 and same result.

Only L7130 and L7560 get voltage.

threads.title: 820-00165 ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V
threads.message:
"ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V I get around 3V for a few seconds after I plug the charger."
Which other voltages (big coils) appear at same time?
Also check U1950 pins in these few seconds.

threads.title: 820-00165 ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V
threads.message:
All big coils get voltage for about 1 second, even vcore comes up.

U1950 
Pin 8 steady 3.4V
All other pins pulse for about 1 second.

threads.title: 820-00165 ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V
threads.message:
Any pulse at PLT_RESET_L?
If not, check at CPU_VCCST_PWRGD and CPU_VR_READY.

Check all SPI Bus Termination resistors and their traces.
Inspetc J/U6100 for corrosion.

threads.title: 820-00165 ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V
threads.message:
PLT_RESET_L 0V no pulse
CPU_VCCST_PWRGD and CPU_VR_READY  both pulse around 1V

J/U6100 are both perfect.

SPI Bus Termination resistors and their traces look perfect too.

threads.title: 820-00165 ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V
threads.message:
Heat CPU/PCH with quality flux.
Is possible to have accumulated crap underneath.

Just in case, test first starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 820-00165 ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V
threads.message: That did not work, but UC did the trick, thanks a lot!
